channel.title: 🔥 Open Data hot twitter posts | by onData
channel.description: Tweets about open data, which have received at least 10 hearts or retweets, in many languages

item.title: #en @ 1465332894340112392
item.description: 🇨🇭 Since 2020, all federal services in #Switzerland publish their open access data. On the website of @opendataswiss you can find a decision tree which helps them to determine whether particular data can be open or not. Check it out: https://t.co/zPRGpdgWxz #OpenGovernmentData https://t.co/ivHFyRpvLn

item.title: #en @ 1465320190988668928
item.description: We all have more important things to worry about, but still curious how to reconcile requirements for open data in journals when some of the most widely used climate datasets are based on proprietary data that will never be available (e.g., GPCC precipitation)

item.title: #en @ 1465283980635164679
item.description:
ONCEs.
For Mobile Users.
Here's the trick if you exceeded. Turn off mobile data. Airplane Mode. Wait for one minute.
Reconnect to your device or turn off the airplane mode. Then open data.
Then vote again (different account)
Do it again and again if you exceeded. https://t.co/BENJ9dtXHF

item.title: #en @ 1465121602782257154
item.description: My guess is that Ontario's 5-11 doses are falling under "Undisclosed or missing" in the open data set. You can see the number of such cases began changing level on the 25th here. item.title: #en @ 1465075744711880715
item.description: I just don't understand why p-hackers share open data. It is so easy to call their BS. Regression with explicit measure and race IAT limited to non-Black participants. And FWIW, I only saw that the last author is a senior male Baumeister student. So criticism is ok, I hope. https://t.co/hKUfq1hLbZ

item.title: #en @ 1465060523087699968
item.description:
For day 1 gappers (35%+) here are the probabilities of the premarket high being broken to the upside during regular trading hours.
Segmented by percentage "give-back", meaning the percentage difference between the premarket high and the Open.
Data since 2020+. 988 samples. https://t.co/uV6MGzjMM5

item.title: #es @ 1464401041970151431
item.description: The Graph anima a los proyectos y desarrolladores a crear APIs de código abierto llamadas subgrafos, de modo que pueda existir una economía de datos abiertos en la que cualquiera pueda acceder a cualquier dato en función de sus requisitos. @graphprotocol https://t.co/LQmfTNknzK

item.title: #en @ 1464392279116890113
item.description:
Did you know? The Graph encourages projects & developers to create open-source APIs called subgraphs, so that an open data economy can exist where anyone can access any data based on their requirements.
Learn how to build a subgraph here: https://t.co/MOhfybs4ky

item.title: #en @ 1464305362555879429
item.description:
Here's some interesting data from HRM Open Data
Vehicle-pedestrian Injury Collisions Jan to Sep
78 - 2021 - + 37% from 57 - 2020
But we know 2020 was depressed due to Covid-19 so let's compare to 2019
78 - 2021 - + 18% from 66 - 2019
So much for any downward trend.
